channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bags and cardboard adjacent to commercial bins, 9th August
item.description:
This rubbish has been here for over a week on the street. I am not sure if it has been inadvertenty placed by the business or if it is from local people believing the business should process it, but the bins here attract this behaviour. If it was the business they should have containers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 96, Rodney Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bags, timber and toys strewn across the pavement with food waste adding to the mess and smell., 9th August
item.description:
This fly tip has been there for a few days now with no cleaning and the foxes are opening the bags to get at rotten food.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Millfields Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen tree, 9th August
item.description:
There is a fallen tree across the footpath in crossways park. Will be a hazard in the dark.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastern Way, London

item.title: Bank and whole road, 9th August
item.description:
Is full of litter and flytipping. It looks like a lot of the fly tipping is from the properties that back on to the bank as well It looks awful

item.title: Over hanging bushes and blackberry plants, 9th August
item.description:
These are overhanging on to the road and potential to cut someone Whilst they look after the front of the church they should not leave overhanging vegetation
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Giggs Hill, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Litter and bird feathers, 9th August
item.description:
Now that part of the pavement has been blocked off by the building company, litter and feathers/ dirt from the pigeons roosting under the bridge are accumulating. Feathers are sticking to the mesh covering the fence. Should not the company keep that part of the pavement clean which is inaccessible due to their building fence? Would you ask them? (Unfortunately, no contact number is displayed).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128-136, Beckenham Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fridge fly tipped on the carriageway on 31st July at 19.08. The event is saved on cctv including index and event., 9th August
item.description:
Cctv footage saved. Index number of vehicle involved is on the picture enclosed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valentine Avenue, Albany Park, London

item.title: Fly tipping, 9th August
item.description:
Yet again more illegal fly tipping. Every time it is cleared more rubbish is dumped within a few days More preventative measures need to be implemented.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pontefract Road, Sundridge, London

Underpass under Redriff road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redriff Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree vegetation on tree trunk blocks street lighting on road. Causing black zone., 9th August
item.description:
Tree opposite 20-36 phelp street Se17 2ph, has huge vegetation growing from tree trunk. This has not been tended to for the longest time. Now seriously overgrown, causes half of road to be pitch black. Women feel unsafe walking home, as cannot see if someone hiding in bushes/ also I have seen foxes residing in bushes at night. Vegetation on trunk needs to be cut back so it doesn't grow back.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree snapped in half, 9th August
item.description:
This tree has has split in half and is hanging over the footpath l. This is now stopping anyone from walking on the footpath. The only was to pass this part is to walk in the road which is dangerous to both road users and the general public. Particularly dangerous to parents with children and disabled people.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dorset Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New parking system pole fixed into pavement, 9th August
item.description:
I appreciate the council needs to install infrastructure to enforce the new parking zones. Unfortunately, this pole which I assume is for that purpose, has been placed in the pavement. This now creates a hazard where it's possibly blocking safe access by wheelchairs, pushchairs, and other mobility devices. There's ample place in the grass to fix this pole but someone decided this is best. I'm writing in the hopes that this can be rectified before further works are completed. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coptefield Drive, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large branch of tree on pavement, 9th August
item.description:
A large branch of a tree has fallen and is on the pavement. It wasn’t cleared by the garden refuse collection.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sharon Gardens, Hackney, London

item.title: Blocking vision in & out of Harefield onto Onslow, 9th August
item.description:
There are 3 trees needing pruning in Onslow Drive of overgrowth low down all blocking vision for driving plus narrowing pavement access for pedestrians. One near no.3 onslow, the other two further up towards Royal Road. I have seen work carried out in Wren Rd so hopefully these too will be pruned accordingly. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Onslow Drive, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loud music, public nuisance, 9th August
item.description:
At least 20 people are dancing to loud music, which is audible from a significant distance. The loud music is disturbing the peace and tranquility of the park. According to the signage, they have been performing at the bandstand since 14:00 and intend to continue until sometime between 19:00 and 21:00 tonight. Could you please put an end to this disturbance? If they have been granted a license to hold this event in the park, please revoke it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cumberland Gate, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet
